Chap. 6 - To Ministers, Physicians, and Teachers
in Southern California

     The men who stand as leaders in any part of the solemn work of the gospel message must cultivate and cherish broad views and ideas. It is the privilege of all who bear responsibilities in the work of the gospel to be apt learners in the school of Christ. The professed follower of Christ must not be led by the dictates of his own will; his mind must be trained to think Christ's thoughts, and enlightened to comprehend the 
                                                                           43
will and way of God. Such a believer will be a follower of Christ's methods of work.
